alert.note: Alert for Barton; Benton; Camden; Cedar; Hickory; Morgan; St. Clair; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 28 at 11:55AM CDT until July 29 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values around 106 to 111 * WHERE...In Kansas, Bourbon and Crawford Counties. In Missouri, Benton, Morgan, Vernon, St. Clair, Hickory, Camden, Barton and Cedar Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Barton; Benton; Camden; Cedar; Hickory; Morgan; St. Clair; Vernon
